title: China waives income tax for foreign investors trading yuan crude futures
text: March 20, 2018 / 2:13 AM / Updated 8 minutes ago China waives income tax for foreign investors trading yuan crude futures Reuters Staff 1 Min Read BEIJING (Reuters) - China will waive income tax for three years for foreign investors trading the countryâ€™s new crude futures contract, the Ministry of Finance said on Tuesday, in a bid to attract overseas capital for the much anticipated launch. FILE PHOTO: A 100 Yuan note is seen in this illustration picture in Beijing, China March 7, 2011. REUTERS/David Gray/Illustration/File Photo Foreign brokers will be exempted from paying income tax on commissions they earn from dealing in Shanghai crude futures, the finance ministry said. China will launch the crude futures contract on March 26. Reporting by Meng Meng and Aizhu Chen;
